poem.title: A CalMac boat
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
A CalMac boat will gently bump
The pier to say - we're here! Geography stops.
With all that glass being flannelled
You would think it was a telescope.
A baritone burp, the newborn baby
Deflates like a soufflé
Chin propped up, the two eyes of surprise.
